biospec_descr.textblock: whole blood, plasma, isolated leukocytes, skeletal muscle, fat, skin

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to examine important and significant problems, that of insulin
      resistance and muscle wasting after burn injury.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study of Insulin Resistance and Muscle Wasting After Burn Injury

detailed_description.textblock:
Burn injury induces insulin resistance and our investigators have previous shown the
      importance of insulin receptor substrate 1 (IRS-1)-mediated pathways.  This project will
      establish the inhibitory effects of burn injury on IRS-1 mediated signaling in human
      skeletal muscle of burn patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Burn injury >=10% total body surface area involvement from any etiology that will
             require surgical treatment

          -  Age 18 years or older

          -  Admitted to the Massachusetts General Hospital within 30 days of burn injury

          -  Patient or guardian who is capable of giving full informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Decision not to treat due to severity of injury

          -  Presence of anoxic brain injury that is not expected to result in complete recovery

          -  Existence of co-morbid conditions of malignancy currently under treatment, medical
             condition requiring glucocorticoid treatment, insulin dependent diabetes mellitus,
             morbid obesity defined as body mass index >= 40

study_pop.textblock:
Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) burn patients from the emergency department,
        intensive care unit, burn unit, or other MGH inpatient unit

clinical_study.official_title: Project 4: Molecular Mechanisms in Burn-induced Insulin Resistance in Humans

primary_outcome.description: Determination of individual profiles and comparison with profiles from existing patients and healthy controls
primary_outcome.measure: Determination of gene expression profile and protein expression
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time of burn injury up to 24 months postinjury

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: National Institute of General Medical Sciences (NIGMS)

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of incidence of clinical complications related to organ function/dysfunction
Analysis of change in total body weight, lean body mass, indirect calorimetry, and nitrogen balance
Gene and and protein expression data will be correlated with the physiological and and in vivo physiologic measurements (lab values) and nutritional status data.
secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between protein data and in vivo physiologic measurement data

clinical_study.source: National Institute of General Medical Sciences (NIGMS)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of General Medical Sciences (NIGMS)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
